queries

Class Queries

  • java.lang.Object
    • queries.Queries

  • public class Queries
extends java.lang.Object
    This file provides methods for collecting and processing data through queries from the social web
    Author:
    Luke Heavens & Ben Carr

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A user object for the given username
        Throws:
        QueryException

      • getTrendingTweets

        public java.util.List<twitter4j.Status> getTrendingTweets(java.lang.String queryString,
                                                 java.lang.Double latitude,
                                                 java.lang.Double longitude,
                                                 double radius)
                                                   throws QueryException
        getTrendingTweets finds any tweets which match the query (and geolocation if available)
        Parameters:
        queryString - - Search term to be used to find tweets
        latitude - - Geolocation latitude (can be NaN)
        longitude - - Geolocation longitude (can be NaN)
        radius - - Geolocation radius in kilometers (can be NaN)
        Returns:
        List of Status objects (tweets)
        Throws:
        QueryException

      • getRetweeters

        public java.util.List<twitter4j.User> getRetweeters(long tweetId)
                                             throws QueryException
        getRetweeters finds 10 users who have retweeted a given tweet
        Parameters:
        tweetId - - The unique id of the tweet
        Returns:
        A list of user objects who have retweeted the tweet
        Throws:
        QueryException

      • getDiscussedTopics

        public Pair<java.util.LinkedList<Term>,java.util.LinkedList<Term>> getDiscussedTopics(java.util.LinkedList<twitter4j.User> users,
                                                                             int termsDesired,
                                                                             int daySpan)
                                                                               throws QueryException
        This function can review tweets from a number of users and extract words that are used frequently. This should indicate discussion topics that are popular. A stop list is used to filter out words that are not content specific
        Parameters:
        users - - The number of users to review
        termsDesired - - The number of terms to extract
        daySpan - - From how many days ago should tweets be extracted
        Returns:
        - A pair of lists of terms. The t item of the pair contains the desired ranked terms, the u contains the remaining unranked terms
        Throws:
        QueryException

      • makeInvertedIndexOfTerms

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Integer>>> makeInvertedIndexOfTerms(java.util.LinkedList<twitter4j.User> users,
                                                                                                                               java.lang.String formattedDate)
                                                                                                                                  throws QueryException
        Takes a list of users and a date and returns a complex inverted index of terms Each term maps to a pair containing the total occurrence count and an user count map. The user count map, maps a user name to their individual occurrence count
        Parameters:
        users - - A list of users whose tweets should be collected
        formattedDate - - A date from which tweets should start to be collected
        Returns:
        - Inverted index
        Throws:
        QueryException

        private java.util.LinkedList<Pair<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Integer>> extractUserCounts(java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Integer> userCountMap)
        Takes a map of userTermCounts and returns a list of pairs
        Parameters:
        userCountMap - - Map of user counts
        Returns:
        - List of pairs

      • getUserVenues

        public java.util.List<fi.foyt.foursquare.api.entities.CompleteVenue> getUserVenues(java.lang.String username,
                                                                          int days)
                                                                            throws QueryException
        getUserVenues finds any venues that a user has visited in the past x days
        Parameters:
        username - - Twitter username to search for
        days - - Days in the past to search for checkins (0 uses live streaming)
        Returns:
        List of Checkins also containing venue information
        Throws:
        QueryException

      • getVenueFromTweet

        public fi.foyt.foursquare.api.entities.CompleteVenue getVenueFromTweet(twitter4j.Status tweet)
                                                                throws QueryException
        This function attempts to get a venue based on a tweet that contains foursquare information
        Parameters:
        tweet - - A tweet that is suspected of containing foursquare information
        Returns:
        A venue object if a venue is found, null otherwise
        Throws:
        QueryException

      • expandFoursquareUrl

        private java.lang.String[] expandFoursquareUrl(java.lang.String shortUrl)
                                        throws QueryException
        expandFoursquareUrl takes a shortened Foursquare URL (4sq.com) and extracts user_id and authorisation code
        Parameters:
        shortUrl - - String of shortened Foursquare URL
        Returns:
        String array of user_id and authorisation code
        Throws:
        QueryException

      • getUsersAtVenue

        public void getUsersAtVenue(java.lang.String venueName,
                   double latitude,
                   double longitude,
                   double radius,
                   int days,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,fi.foyt.foursquare.api.entities.CompleteVenue> venues,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<twitter4j.Status>> venueTweets)
                     throws QueryException
        getUsersAtVenue finds users who have vistited a venues in a specific geographic area and/or with a certain name in the last X days
        Parameters:
        venueName - - Name of a venue as a String
        latitude - - Geolocation latitude
        longitude - - Geolocation longitude
        radius - - Geolocation radius from lat/long
        days - - Days in the past to search for (0 = Live Stream)
        venues - - Hashmap of venueIds and CompleteVenue objects
        venueTweets - - Hashmap of tweetIds and Status objects
        Throws:
        QueryException
